```{r}
library(git2r)
repo <- repository()
```

See if we are on master and all is good

```{r}

checkout(repo,"master")
repo
```

Useful stuff from hadley.  To create a branch, open the shell and enter

git checkout -b <branch-name>

Also need to create branch on github with

git push --set-upstream origin <branch-name>

A couple of merges:

1.  regularly merge master into branch so that they remain consisitent with

git merge master

2.  When done, return to master (either with dropdown or git checkout master) and then

git merge <branch-name>

And to delete (only works if merged

git branch -d <branch-name>

Branch will now show in dropdown; you can work to your hearts content and the master will be undisturbed.  Then, to merge
